messages.message:
RBS sent me this note, what would be the difficulty in accomplishing this:

 "One specific problem that they explained was around generating legal documents based on the specific needs of the engagement, and ensuring they are always up to date. Right now, we have a large number (<100) of different Legal Templates that we use, and as policy changes we have to manually update them all. Could we build a workflow on Instabase that essentially defined a set of generic templates, and then pulls in relevant policy attributes from different sources as and when we need it to ensure they remain relevant?"
If I’m reading this correctly, this is remarkably similar to a use case I got from some medical laboratories
They have a set of patient tests they run, and need to submit billing reimbursement to insurance companies
But each insurance company has slightly different requirements / classifications / medical descriptions that they respond to in their policy
Should I setup a call to walk in more detail of the use case? Do we want to spend capacity if we can guarantee an outcome for a $$$ POC?
So it results in 100% bespoke billing documents but generated from a decision tree
(e.g.: Blood Test for Condition X ----> Result Positive ----> Insurance Company XYC ----> Let’s use Template 10 and paste in Extra Clause 3)

Personal Answer: I would love to work on this.
Company Answer: I worry that it might stretch us too thin.
Document generation is a super exciting area though
That, at high level, would be an entirely new set of use cases we could sell
Well i'll setup a meeting with RBS to scope high level requirements, Ted can I include you?
My gut feeling is that this should be estimated as the same LoE as the SwissRE or Citi work
(e.g.: near full time app authoring over 1-3 months)
In terms of a first estimate of cost
I can talk about how RBS has a super unique system for bringing companies in and if this is our break-in, it will be worth it.
Should we do this, I know the founding team at UpCounsel quite well and it's something they might be interested in talking about (although they aren't big enough for 7 figure deals tbh)
